comments.text:
> Randomly encounters a guy

> Going into town

> Sleeping in an inn

> Getting an airship

> Got chased across town

> Going through an underground passage by the help of the guy then he leaves

> Getting surrounded by bad guys

> The guy saves the day

I feel like playing a JRPG, not watching an anime though
This anime is great for giving me ideas to throw into my homebrew dnd world!
It's literally the start of the game i downloaded the app recently
If this was a FF game they just found their Cid equivalent.
I'm actually just gonna call him Cid from now and on.
Well, the anime is adaptating the game pretty literally so is natural.

I really don't have the time or energy to play massive time sink JRPGs anymore, so it's really nice to just watch a glorified Let's Play with all the boring grinding cut out and the graphics cleaned up.
I like the JRPG feel. It's pretty enjoyable.
Well the JRPG version developed by Platinum is coming to PS4 next year so there is hope

>Platinum

Time to pre-order.
[Yup](http://gematsu.com/2016/09/granblue-fantasy-project-re-link-launches-ps4-japan-2018), there's only one trailer though, the one we saw in Sony's TGS 2016. Hopefully we see more at E3

> Platinum

Hype.
Ah! This! This is what I was trying to explain before in my other post. It feels like a JRPG, not an anime! That's exactly it.
had the exact same feeling while watching Tales of Zestiria the X
nah, Tales of Zestiria cut out most of the typical JRPG aspects present in the game.

[I can relate so much more with Katalina now](http://i.imgur.com/zPAWDX5.png), she' great. Already shipping her with Rackam too who seems pretty cool himself.

[Also please be good](http://i.imgur.com/Q4wS9cl.png) loving this character's design already!!

EDIT: [Catalina scene <3](https://my.mixtape.moe/ukgbqw.webm)

> Also please be good loving this character's design already!!

Agreed, she looks awesome! Though I can't help but think that (a) whatever vine magic she was using would be a great obstacle for the protagonists to face, and (b) the villains so far have been more annoying than threatening, so I wouldn't mind if someone competent and cool-looking like her became the Darth Vader of the series.

However, [{heavy, spoilery speculation:} ](/s "the last couple shots of the ED make it look like there will eventually be a party of 8 protagonists, including Rackam, this lady, a blonde crystal girl, and a giant eyepatch rifle guy")
[Story characters](/s "Correct, only lacking one character (Lecia) although I'm not sure if we can get that far.")

Thanks, but I'm not going to read that. I don't want to know for sure! 

(Actually, I scrolled further down the thread, saw people are posting confirmation/denial of my speculation without even spoiler tags, so I'm abandoning all these discussion threads for this show in order to experience the show unsullied. But thanks for being one of the good people who put it in tags! I really do appreciate it!)

After two episodes of building her up as a reliable female swordswoman, it's fun to see that image slowly crumble as she reveals more of her cuter self: 

Such as being completely useless when it comes to flying airships, and totally losing it when in the presence of cute fluffy animals. XD
It looks like we found our lady of black magic, pretty sure she will indeed be part of the good guys.

> lady of black magic

How dare you insult our beloved joshikousei

>  Also please be good loving this character's design already!!


Oh she will be ;).

>Also please be good loving this character's design already!!

JK <3
[you don't know half of it](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2pcmo1WBdd8)
It started with Sawashiro Miyuki and just keeps getting worse, every time I think I can't love Katalina more she effortlessly proves me wrong.

Klein and Gintoki joined the cast, niceeee. Their voices are so distinctive along with Nao's and Sawashiro's... That's what truly brings out the character.

I hope Rackam joins the crew for good.

> I hope Rackam joins the crew for good.

I think he and plant girl must, since their silhouettes are in the group shot at the end of the ending theme.
I hope that plant girl is the ~ara ara type of girl...

I was reading this comment as the ED was playing, and I thought "I agree they should join so that we get closer to seven party members." Then checked said group shot, and ho surprise, seven people.

JRPGs are highly predictable, and I like that.

> seven party members

Lol'd, try playing the game, you're off by 2 digits.
Is seven really a major thing? -has mostly played .hack, Neptunia, and Final Fantasy-

I haven't found a dedicated page, but it looks to me like it's common. On the top of my mind, JRPGs with seven playable characters include Final Fantasy X, Final Fantasy VII if you exclude the "optional" ones Yuffie and Vincent, Chrono Trigger, and Tales of the Abyss.

I might be biased by the games I know, though, so I'm not sure.
Granblue has a lot more than seven, even on the "main" story. It is a Gatcha game after all.
They might limit it to seven for the anime, though.
They would be stupid to not even include one of the fan favorites of the game.

The core group during the Girl in Blue arc is [](/s "seven plus mascot"). [Core group members](/s "Gran, Lyria, Katalina, Rackam, Io, Eugen, Rosetta. Lecia joins near the end but hardly does anything, and she hasn't been featured in promotional material for the anime.") The vast majority of gacha characters isn't relevant to the main story, so I'd be surprised if they do more than just some cameos here and there, if they show them off at all.

Some of the gacha characters are implied to be on the canon crew. I don't know if they will show them, but I expect at least some cameos. [And lets be honest](/s "There is no way Vira is not showing up")
I hope we get as far as that island. I want her to show up.
I swear to god [if they don't show](/s "yandere onee-sama crazed best girl") I will riot...

Hm. Well, if it went off my screen (usually four), I stopped counting, so I can't actually say how many characters most games I've played had. It just always seemed like only four or a whole ton. (Neptunia has like.... 25ish if you include the DLC. Too many... =_=)

> Too many... =_=

You should play Chrono Cross, lmao.

Oh men... this feeling, with this episode i felt back to 2001 when i was a little 7 years old shit playing some JRPGs in a rainy day and skipping school, that ''comfy'' feeling of bright adventure and discovery omg... i haven't feel like this in a looong ass time, nostalgia is working me hard in this show, i can't not like this, i can't be objetive with this.

> that ''comfy'' feeling of bright adventure and discovery omg... i haven't feel like this in a looong ass time, nostalgia is working me hard in this show

Seriously, this series rekindles a feeling in me that I thought I had long been dead to. It's *almost* like I'm playing Grandia for the first time again. I love it.
It reminds me heavily of the world of Ivalice with a Final Fantasy IX airship feeling. It's great.

It's basically Final Fantasy in a non-cgi style.

And, damn, do I love this show for it!
Yeah, what's up with that? The floating island/steampunk combo always gives me immense nostalgia and I've never even played a jrpg in my life.

Finally a new episode after the first that aired in January. Too many references to name in this episode but it was beautiful. Sturm looks sooo cute, together with Drang the pair are even more funny animated. And the music, no need to even bother recording new ones. Just use the in-game ones it couldn't have been easier and better too.

Character animation is very scruffy. Even with the money of Cygames backing this production I don't think this anime is going to be the primary output of A-1 this season. At least all the background art looks pretty.

Yup, this isn't

Looking at this and Eromanga Sensei's animation, hardly anyone would believe that the same studio animates them

I find this decision to be really dumb, Granblue is one of the most popular games in Japan and they decided to half-ass it. Maybe they think they can do anything and it will sell because of the extras on the blu-rays >_>

I don't think it's half-assed at all. The issue is that they decided to go with character designs that are incredibly hard to animate so even scenes that look worse to us than other shows actually required more effort on their part.

[Best girl](http://imgur.com/p6OCrtK) [Sturm](http://imgur.com/AwQLCsv) has finnaly appeared !

And I really enjoyed this episode a lot more than the first two. I was a bit unsure about the art direction at first, and while it still seems to fluctuate in quality a lot there are a lot of [beautiful shots](http://i.imgur.com/05pobs2.jpg).

The plot seems to be moving at a nice pace as well, it will be interesting to see how far they get.
Sorry. Her concept is great, but I can't like her clothing design.

Art aside, I think the OST is pretty nice, to a point where it blends just so perfectly with the setting and situation that you don't really pay attention to it.

Of course, it is kinda cliché fantasy anime music, but not all clichés are bad.

This town reminded me of Lindblum is Final Fantasy IX. With all the airships and how the town is structured. Also the various shops you encounter here. 

Rackam is the first ally i'd assume, he's cool.

Since the first episode I can't stop thinking about FFIX while watching this. We have a cute girl on the run, a ~~fat man~~ another cute woman is on her side, some stranger is also involved, we have air ships and the design of some places like you said. 

But on the other hand, I loved playing FFIX, so I am not really neutral on that.
Even the classes in-game are very FF-esque
Nobuo eutmatsu from final fantasy 4 is doing the OST, and the art direction is by the guy how directed final fantasy 6, so the FF vibes are off the charts here.

Holy shit! Sturm so [tiny!!](http://imgur.com/a/9KOVg) I knew Draph women are small in the game, but she's shorter than Lyria!

I'm really enjoying this so far...I only wish A-1 could've given a bit more love to the animation as it does feel a little...lacking at times. The art style I love, however.

Really hoping we get to see some crowd favorites later on. Rackam and [plant girl](/s "Rosetta") along with Drang and Sturm are a par for the course and it looks like we'll get the rest of the core "crew" from the OP etc...but I'd love to see the likes of [potential spoilers](/s "Vira, Apollo, Orchid...Silva...maybe even the Society members")

Never really posted on here before...always been a resident lurker but I've been playing GBF religiously since the start of this year so I felt compelled to make a post...if anyone is considering giving the game a go after watching the show, I highly recommend it. Despite most gacha games, you can *technically* play full F2P, though your progression will be slowed down considerably. Since I started, however, Cygames have been quite generous with extra stuff they offer. Not sure if talking about the game is against sub rules, I'll edit my post if so, just wanted to give my thoughts :)
Sturm is so fucking tiny and cute it's unreal. Wasn't very wowed by the first two episodes, but encountering a character design as interesting as that was certainly a 'wow' moment for me! I'm sold!

Pretty good worldbuilding so far, characters feel more lively than those in Zestiria already.


Already love Rackam's personality, it's great how they're slowly building a crew for themselves, sorta feels like One Piece in the sky.


The fight scenes are on point too, good job A-1.
RACKAAAAAAM
Why is this post so empty? I thought the first two episodes were awesome, didn't many others?

> first two episodes were awesome

your taste is pretty generic then
> thinking generic = bad
it is
You're wrong.
ok

As a side note even a generic plot or characters can be good if they're well executed the same way something that is innovative is not always good. That something is overused doesn't mean that someone can't pull that overused thing good. This anime is using the fomula all the first final fantasies used in the early 90s, almost the same plot and narattive, and as far as i know i still hear to this day in the gaming community people wanting more old school stories, could be nostalgia talking but still.
welllllll art is shit animation is shit characters and plot are generic af. even good execution cant save this anime, saying its awesome is insult to actual awesome animes

Then all old school 90s rpgs are also generic by that logic right? You're the one with the mindset that generic = bad when in a work of entertaiment all that matters first that anything else is execution.

> Then all old school 90s rpgs are also generic by that logic right

i dont  and never played 90s rpgs so whatever logic jumping you do from those.. i dont care about it

> You're the one with the mindset that generic = bad 

generic animes are bad, yes 

> when in a work of entertaiment all that matters first that anything else is execution.

everything else about this anime sucks tho? so whats your point?? this is worst anime of the season on par with headshakers

> handshakers

You're insane. It may be generic but nothing else is outright bad in any way, you just don't like it.

Probably because those who enjoy old school fantasy are in the minority. It comes of as generic, so people either don't pick it up or just drop it after the first episode. Their loss though. I'm enjoying it well enough.

Well, cause it is fairly generic and it's not the issue with the genre.

Damsel in distress? Check. Country boy to save the day? Check. Annoying pet? >_> Big bad that that has to be defeated against all odds? Check. Acquiring party members as you go along your quest? Check. 

I'd like this a lot more if Lyria and Vryn were simply not part of the story. 

Zero kara Hajimeru Mahou no Sho is not as generic even though it's also fantasy.

Generic ≠ Bad. It is generic, yes, since uses the same exact plot old school JRPGs from the early 90s had but thats not inherently bad, now all comes to pacing and execution, even a cliche can be good if is well made. As you see in the comments a lot of people is watching this show because it brings back memories of those older days where the fantasy genre was more simple without the need of so many plot twists.

It seems like a pretty generic fantasy to me, but in like a.... not generic anime fantasy, more generic generic fantasy sort of way? If that makes sense? (I'm sure it doesn't, but I'm not sure how else to say it.) And I'm actually enjoying that part a lot. The comedy though is... not my style. And I find it really weird that helpful people keep popping up left and right. Either they have incredible luck or there are a lot of people stalking that lieutenant.

> more generic generic fantasy sort of way?

Basically old school/ Classic high fantasy
It's not really high fantasy though, high fantasy would be Tolkien or D&D stuff with elves and western-style dragons. This is more like a Final Fantasy (IX, XII) style of steampunk imo.

I feel like the first two episodes being released early may have killed the hype a bit, but hopefully people will come back once they realize new episodes are comming out.

For me, I started to really enjoy the artstyle and they are moving the plot along nicely, much better than in the game.
Im just here waiting for mama Forte

I'm actually kinda glad she won't make an appearance because I don't think I could take her seriously having her height in mind. Being constantly reminded that female Draphs are ~130 cm tall while she babysits those kids would be awkward for my brain.
M O N I K A BOIZ
Good luck!
Vira/Silva please. In fact, I'd settle for anyone from my main team (Altair/Silva/Ririru/Lancelot...Kat excluded, since she was guaranteed to be in it).
Let's hope we can get Altair. He's the best bookworm
Sugita pulled out that Joseph voice

As someone that has played quite a bit of GBF but skipped over all the story bits, I'm happy this anime exists. Even though I know all the major plot points I'm glad to see the entire story for the first time when its animated instead of just text boxes. Now to just wait patiently until best girl shows up
B-but [best girl](https://gbf.wiki/images/f/f5/Zooey_B.png) won't show up...
[N-no... It can't be...!](http://i.imgur.com/hqt05Km.png)
Oh yes [she](https://gbf.wiki/images/9/98/BlackKnight_A.png) will

Top 10 for sure, but even if I don't consider Zoey she has some serious competition imo. Zeta, Bea, Naru, Katalina, Korwa, Yuisis...

I was expecting Vira though, I'm glad you have a considerably better taste than my friends.
it's probably just me, but didn't the art seem abit..off? like it was colored in by crayon? I went back and the other 2 episodes looked quite different.
It's a pretty unique artstyle, people find it bad since they're not used to it yet. But I personally feel that it fits.

I didn't notice the difference, but the art sure is unusual. I like it, though, it's pretty unique and I think the art style fits the story style perfectly.

One of my friends said the art looks very bad to him. Curse him !

Third episode looks great!

I think the main problem with the art style is the inconsistency in thickness of the lines, which makes it look unpolished.
Cagliostro Where :(

Anime-only watcher here. After the disappointment of Chain Chronicle from last season, I'm enjoying Granblue a lot more. As the others have said, GBF feels a lot like an old-school JRPG, the kind of games that Square used to put out before their merger with Enix.
I really really like characters and armors they so unique and beautifuly done

Im really, really loving this show so far....the art style, character designs, music both background mid-episode and OP/ED, all the stuff going on in the backgrounds, to me it sets like a nice nostalgic "mood", and so far everything happening plot-wise has been cool, in my opinion!
Katalina is lovely. I already love her. Good episode.
I am surprised that I am liking it this much.  I guess I have never seen a true high fantasy anime with out some sort of twist.  Just a flying steampunk high fantasy adventure!  I like it

JRPG is definitely the perfect description for this show as many are saying. I like it! These days I really don't have the time to play grand scale JRPGs so I'm happy that we have adaptations like these that just cuts in straight to the story.
I really dig the art of this show

As a game player, I like how this show is going.  I doubt it will get too far in the story, but it will serve as a nice intro in the game's world and maybe convince a few people to get into the game.  I'm really enjoying seeing the height differences between different races, especially the Draph (Sturm's race).  It really showed how short Draph women are without being childlike like the Harvin.
Can't wait for Draph MEN to appear in the series proper. I imagine [person who will appear later](/s "Tzaka the Great") being huge.

man, Lyria and the loli characters are irritating to me. 

but Katalina makes the show watchable. I'm gonna stick with it...
